chinese: [C] a particular area of activity, work, knowledge, etc. （活动、工作、知识等的）范围，领域
examples: e.g. Women have been taking more important positions of power in the public [[sphere]].

chinese: the best or most important 最好的；最重要的
examples: e.g. He is one of the country's [[foremost]] authorities on criminal law.

chinese: [C, U] a book in which sb. writes about their own life 自传
examples: e.g. He gives a vivid description of his childhood in his [[autobiography]].

chinese: important 重要的；著名的；卓越的；杰出的
examples: e.g. He played a [[prominent]] role in promoting public health awareness in developing countries.

chinese: make a good combination with sb. / sth. else 补充；使相配；使完美
examples: e.g. For the show, the museum is borrowing 20 paintings that [[complement]] its own collection.

chinese: complementary things go well together, although they are usually different 互为补充的；互补的
examples: e.g. The computer and the human mind have different but [[complementary]] abilities.

chinese: (the ~) a leading or important position 最前线；最前列；最重要的位置
examples: e.g. The company has always been at the [[forefront]] of science and technology.

chinese: 1) writing which expresses judgments about the good or bad qualities of books, films, music, etc. （对书、电影、音乐等的）评论
examples: e.g. Art [[criticism]] is about how we evaluate and interpret art.；e.g. My main [[criticism]] of the scheme is that it does nothing to help families on low incomes.

chinese: 2) remarks that say what you think is bad about sb. / sth. 批评；批判
examples: e.g. Art [[criticism]] is about how we evaluate and interpret art.；e.g. My main [[criticism]] of the scheme is that it does nothing to help families on low incomes.

chinese: 1) [C, U] clothes that are typical of a particular place or period of time in the past （代表某一特定地方或历史时期的）服装，装束
examples: e.g. The dancers were in national [[costume]] to celebrate the National Day.；e.g. Maybe you should take off that wolf [[costume]] and show him how it's done.

chinese: 2) [C] a set of clothes worn by an actor or by sb. to make them look like sth., such as an animal or a famous person. 戏装；演出服
examples: e.g. The dancers were in national [[costume]] to celebrate the National Day.；e.g. Maybe you should take off that wolf [[costume]] and show him how it's done.

chinese: very famous or popular, esp. being considered to represent particular opinions or a particular time （尤指能代表某种观点或某一时代）非常出名的，受欢迎的
examples: e.g. The Phantom of the Opera must be the most [[iconic]] Broadway musical ever, and it's for a good reason — it's so incredible.

chinese: [C] a work of art, a piece of writing or music, etc. that is of very high quality or that is the best that a particular artist, writer, etc. has produced 杰作；名作；代表作
examples: e.g. Mary Shelley was just 21 when she published her [[masterpiece]] Frankenstein.

chinese: (fml.) move sb. / sth. to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before 提拔；晋升；提升
examples: e.g. A well-chosen handbag can really [[elevate]] a woman's level of fashion.

chinese: 1) [U] (fml.) the quality of being useful, or the degree to which sth. is useful 有用；实用性
examples: e.g. I have severe doubts about the [[utility]] of examinations on subjects learned this way.；e.g. Officials said water supplies and other public [[utilities]] in the capital were badly affected.

chinese: 2) [C, usu. pl.] a service such as gas or electricity provided for people to use 公用事业（如煤气、电力等）
examples: e.g. I have severe doubts about the [[utility]] of examinations on subjects learned this way.；e.g. Officials said water supplies and other public [[utilities]] in the capital were badly affected.

chinese: the quality of relating to or limited by time 时效性；短暂性
examples: e.g. He argues that [[temporality]] cannot be identified with ordinary clock time.

chinese: 1) limit sth. 限制；束缚
examples: e.g. Poor soil has [[constrained]] the level of crop production in this area.；e.g. Financial factors should not [[constrain]] doctors from prescribing the best treatment for patients.

chinese: 2) stop sb. from doing what they want to do 阻止；妨碍
examples: e.g. Poor soil has [[constrained]] the level of crop production in this area.；e.g. Financial factors should not [[constrain]] doctors from prescribing the best treatment for patients.

chinese: [C] the shape of the outer edges of sth. such as an area of land or sb.'s body 外形；轮廓
examples: e.g. Maybe you can try this seat — it can be adjusted to fit the [[contours]] of your back.

chinese: the way you think about sth. and your idea of what it is like 认识；观念；看法
examples: e.g. There is a general public [[perception]] that social media can be addictive.

chinese: avant-garde music, literature, etc. is extremely modern and often seems strange or slightly shocking （音乐、文学作品等）前卫的，先锋派的
examples: e.g. His paintings are rather too [[avant-garde]] for my taste.

chinese: sharply defined; easy to understand 明确的；易懂的
examples: e.g. While there are a number of arguments in favor of school uniforms, the issue of whether or not they should be required is not a [[clear-cut]] matter.

chinese: 1) become or make sth. become difficult to distinguish clearly （使）难以区分
examples: e.g. The design of this museum is meant to [[blur]] the distinction between the house and the garden.；e.g. The words [[blurred]] and danced before his eyes.

chinese: 2) become difficult to see, or make sth. difficult to see, because the edges are not clear （使）（某物）模糊不清
examples: e.g. The design of this museum is meant to [[blur]] the distinction between the house and the garden.；e.g. The words [[blurred]] and danced before his eyes.

chinese: oppose or fight against sb. in authority or against an idea or situation which you do not agree with 造反；反抗；反叛
examples: e.g. A vast majority of the voters [[rebelled]] against the high property taxes.

chinese: [C] a show of the work of an artist, actor, film-maker, etc. that includes examples of all the kinds of work they have done （画家、演员、电影制作人等作品的）回顾展
examples: e.g. We timed the release of the film to coincide with a big [[retrospective]] of Bosch's paintings at Rotterdam.

chinese: 1) (only before noun) an offensive way of referring to groups of people or customs that are considered to be simple and not highly developed 蒙昧的；未开化的；野蛮的
examples: e.g. The novel is about a [[savage]] tribe with alien customs and ceremonies.；e.g. They caught the monkey, but it was so [[savage]] that no one could get near enough to feed it.

chinese: 2) very violent or cruel 凶猛的；残暴的
examples: e.g. The novel is about a [[savage]] tribe with alien customs and ceremonies.；e.g. They caught the monkey, but it was so [[savage]] that no one could get near enough to feed it.

chinese: [C, U] a public meeting where land, buildings, paintings, etc. are sold to the person who offers the most money for them 拍卖（会）
examples: e.g. If he did not come back in time, his whole property would be sold by [[auction]].

chinese: 1) old, but of high quality 旧式的，老式的（但品质优良）
examples: e.g. It looks like a [[vintage]] cell phone of the last century and weighs about 13 ounces.；e.g. They served lobster, accompanied by a bottle of [[vintage]] champagne.

chinese: 2) vintage wine is good quality wine made in a particular year （某特定年份酿制的葡萄酒）佳酿的，上等的，优质的
examples: e.g. It looks like a [[vintage]] cell phone of the last century and weighs about 13 ounces.；e.g. They served lobster, accompanied by a bottle of [[vintage]] champagne.

chinese: [U] (also haute-couture) the design and production of expensive and fashionable clothes, or the clothes themselves 昂贵时装的设计制作；昂贵时装
examples: e.g. Around 25 designers will show their [[couture]] collections during the international fashion week.

chinese: [U] 天鹅绒；丝绒
1) (social / legal / political, etc. framework) the structure of a society, a legal or political system, etc. 社会 / 法律 / 政治等的框架
examples: e.g. There is no escaping the fact that we have to act within the existing legal [[framework]].；e.g. This paper provides a useful conceptual [[framework]] for future research.

chinese: 2) [usu. sing.] a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which sth. is developed, or on which decisions are based 体系；体制；框架；准则
examples: e.g. There is no escaping the fact that we have to act within the existing legal [[framework]].；e.g. This paper provides a useful conceptual [[framework]] for future research.

chinese: an inescapable fact or situation is one that you cannot avoid or ignore 不可避免的；不容忽视的
examples: e.g. She didn't want to confront the [[inescapable]] fact that she would have to sell the house.

chinese: [C] sth. that limits your freedom to do what you want 限制；束缚；约束
examples: e.g. [[Constraints]] on spending have forced the company to rethink its plans.

chinese: 1) an unplanned additional result of sth. that you do 意外附带结果
examples: e.g. The deep depression he fell into was a [[byproduct]] of his disease.；e.g. Sugar and its [[byproducts]] are the basis of the island's economy.

chinese: 2) sth. additional that is produced during a natural or industrial process 副产物；副产品
examples: e.g. The deep depression he fell into was a [[byproduct]] of his disease.；e.g. Sugar and its [[byproducts]] are the basis of the island's economy.

chinese: connected with beauty and the study of beauty 美学的
examples: e.g. From an [[aesthetic]] point of view, this piece of furniture is a nice design.

chinese: [C] a product that is bought and sold 商品
examples: e.g. [[Commodity]] prices can be a useful indicator of inflation, he claimed.

chinese: use sth. that you already have in order to achieve sth. new or better 借助已有的···实现新（或更好）的目标
examples: e.g. We can gain a market advantage by [[leveraging]] our network of partners.

chinese: work together with a person or group in order to achieve sth., esp. in science or art （尤指在科学或艺术方面）合作，协作
examples: e.g. Educators and employers need to [[collaborate]] in preparing the next generation for employment.

chinese: [C, U] when you work together with another person or group to achieve sth., esp. in science or art （尤指在科学或艺术方面的）合作，协作
examples: e.g. The company is building the center in [[collaboration]] with an engineering institute.

chinese: [U, sing.] (fml.) a very large amount of sth. 大量；丰富；充沛
examples: e.g. It is a delightful river with a [[profusion]] of wild flowers along its banks.

chinese: sth. that is nonexistent does not exist at all, or is not present in a particular place 不存在的
examples: e.g. Her friends never missed a chance to tease her about her [[nonexistent]] relationship with Brandon.

chinese: (fml.) a symbiotic relationship is one in which the people, organizations, or living things involved depend on each other （人、组织或生物）互相依赖的，共生的
examples: e.g. Do some viruses develop a [[symbiotic]] relationship with their host?

chinese: [C, U] an exchange, esp. of ideas or thoughts （尤指观点或思想的）交流
examples: e.g. What made the meeting exciting was the [[interchange]] of ideas from different disciplines.

chinese: (fml.) (only before noun) according to what is correct or what should be done legally or morally 正确的；合法的；正义的
examples: e.g. George sat at the head of the table, in his [[rightful]] place as their leader.

chinese: very complicated and detailed; carefully prepared and organized 复杂的；详尽的；精心制作的
examples: e.g. You need a plain blouse to go with that skirt — nothing too [[elaborate]].

chinese: (fml.) dealing with ideas, or based on them 概念的
examples: e.g. Some of us learn experientially, while others are more attracted to logical or [[conceptual]] learning.

chinese: relating to your spirit rather than to your body or mind 精神的；心灵的
examples: e.g. While improving material well-being, we should also enrich our [[spiritual]] life.

chinese: used to emphasize the most important quality, purpose, reason, etc. 首先，首要的是（用于强调）
examples: e.g. What children need first and [[foremost]] from their parents is a sense of security.

chinese: 艾尔莎 • 夏帕瑞丽（意大利时装设计师）
伊夫 • 圣 • 罗兰（法国时装设计师）
(Pablo Picasso) 巴勃罗 • 毕加索（西班牙画家、雕塑家）
(Claude Monet) 克劳德 • 莫奈（法国印象派画家）
克莱尔 • 麦克安德鲁（爱尔兰艺术经济学家）
卡尔 • 拉格斐（德国时装设计师）
安迪 • 沃霍尔（美国波普艺术家和电影制片人）
